page.title: 07ROBERT HALL - THE PLACE
page.content: This land belonged to the Cantsfield family in the 13 century. In about 1600 a shelter was provided for catholic priests facing persecution. The chapel ceased to be used in 1817. The Hall is now a farm house. A drawing of 1856 shows it to have had interesting architectural features but these have almost all now been destroyed. No structural change can now take place as it is a listed building. However the present tenants are renovating the interior and discovering all the oak beams which had been plastered over. An original stone fireplace has been discovered and one room has beautiful oak panelling covering it. The interior of Robert Hall will in the near future be restored to something approaching its original state.
